discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
My choices are A & C

questions.question_text: Which of the following actions are controlled with AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Control access to AWS service APIs and to other specific resources.
choices.E: Provide firewall protection for applications from common web attacks.
choices.C: Protect the AWS environment using multi-factor authentication (MFA).
choices.B: Provide intelligent threat detection and continuous monitoring.
choices.D: Grant users access to AWS data centers.

questions.question_text: Why are AWS CloudFormation templates used?

choices.D: To deploy large infrastructure with no cost implications.
choices.C: To reuse on-premises infrastructure in the AWS Cloud.
choices.B: To transfer existing infrastructure to another company.
choices.A: To reduce provisioning time by using automation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. To reduce provisioning time by using automation.

questions.question_text:
A company is using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).

Who can manage the access keys of the AWS account root user?

choices.C: IAM users and roles that have been granted permission
choices.B: IAM roles in any account that have been granted permission
choices.A: IAM users in the same account that have been granted permission

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. The AWS account owner

questions.question_text: Which group shares responsibility with AWS for security and compliance of AWS accounts and resources?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS CloudTrail
For tracking a historical record of AWS resource creation and changes, AWS CloudTrail remains the appropriate choice.

questions.question_text:
A company needs an event history of which AWS resources the company has created.

Which AWS service will provide this information?
